Let $z_1,\ldots,z_n\in \mathbb{C}$ with $z_1=1$. Must there exist an absolute constant $c>0$ such that\[\max_{1\leq k\leq n}\left\lvert \sum_{i}z_i^k\right\rvert>c?\]



A problem of Tur\'{a}n, who proved that this maximum is $\gg 1/n$. This was solved by Atkinson \cite{At61b}, who showed that $c=1/6$ suffices. This has been improved by Bir\'{o}, first to $c=1/2$ \cite{Bi94}, and later to an absolute constant $c>1/2$ \cite{Bi00}. Based on computational evidence it is likely that the optimal value of $c$ is $\approx 0.7$.

See also [973].




References


[At61b] Atkinson, F. V., On sums of powers of complex numbers. Acta Math. Acad. Sci. Hungar. (1961), 185-188.

[Bi00] Bir\'{o}, Andr\'{a}s, An improved estimate in a power sum problem of Tur\'{a}n. Indag. Math. (N.S.) (2000), 343-358.

[Bi94] Bir\'{o}, A., On a problem of Tur\'{a}n concerning sums of powers of complex numbers. Acta Math. Hungar. (1994), 209-216.
